body: I have a change I'm testing from which I'll open a PR.

rename.from: HardlinkedSandboxedSpawn (`--experimental_use_hermetic_linux_sandbox`) does not print interactive debug isntructions
rename.to: HardlinkedSandboxedSpawn (`--experimental_use_hermetic_linux_sandbox`) does not print interactive debug instructions

issue.title: Print interactive debug instructions in HardlinkedSandboxedSpawn

labels.name: team-Local-Exec
labels.description: Issues and PRs for the Execution (Local) team

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
When running with --experimental_use_hermetic_linux_sandbox, this allows us to see the interactive debug instructions like we'd see without it.

Note that `EnterWorkingDirectory()` in `linux-sandbox` requires that the working directory is under the sandbox_root path, so we need to include `cwd=sandboxExecRoot()` when calling `describeCommand`. This is a stricter requirement than for SymlinkedSandboxedSpawn which was changed in #26448 more for UX reasons.

Fixes #26580.

issue.title: [8.4.0] Print interactive debug instructions in HardlinkedSandboxedSpawn

labels.name: team-Local-Exec
labels.description: Issues and PRs for the Execution (Local) team

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
When running with --experimental_use_hermetic_linux_sandbox, this allows us to see the interactive debug instructions like we'd see without it.

Note that `EnterWorkingDirectory()` in `linux-sandbox` requires that the working directory is under the sandbox_root path, so we need to include `cwd=sandboxExecRoot()` when calling `describeCommand`. This is a stricter requirement than for SymlinkedSandboxedSpawn which was changed in #26448 more for UX reasons.

Fixes #26580.

Closes #26581.

body:
A fix for this issue has been included in[Bazel 8.4.0 RC1](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/releases/tag/8.4.0rc1). Please test out the release candidate and report any issues as soon as possible.
If you're using Bazelisk, you can point to the latest RC by setting USE_BAZEL_VERSION=8.4.0rc1. Thanks!

> A fix for this issue has been included in[Bazel 8.4.0 RC1](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/releases/tag/8.4.0rc1). Please test out the release candidate and report any issues as soon as possible. If you're using Bazelisk, you can point to the latest RC by setting USE_BAZEL_VERSION=8.4.0rc1. Thanks!

Yes, that part worked out OK. I found that there's a related problem, though, so I've posted a PR for that one: #26811.
